Dialogs.Dialog: Rinko
Do you know Super Robot Volvavin？
Volvavin？ Ah, I know it！ I watched it back in grade school.
My brother is hooked on it right now.
Oh, reruns？ Get up Volvavin！ Volve Fuuusion！！ Right？
And... What's so fun about that？
It's a cool robot that can transform and it listens to your commands！
Hmm... Still don't get the point.
(The point？)
Rinko
Hey, this Volvavin thing is actually a robot right？ Why does it act like a living thing？
Volvavin？ Ah, the truth is... it has the DNA of the young boy Rintaro's mother.
I see. So, in a pinch, it'll move on its own...
Well then, what about that Special Minister X？ Is he a friend？ Enemy？
Umm... What is he, again？ There was something about a government conspiracy... I think that was it？
Conspiracy！？ Then there's that "Unit 2" that came out of the ancient ruins, right？ What's that？
(So you're addicted to the show now, huh, ▲小早川＊▲？)
Rinko
Hey, did you try playing as Volvavin when you were a kid？
Played as Volvavin？ No, I was already in the 5th grade by that time.
I see... My little brother likes to play as Volvavin right now, but things are not going very well...
Ah, so you have to play as the enemy robot, right ▲小早川＊▲？
Wrong. The young boy, Rintaro. I have to play as him because my name sounds the same.
Haha！ Then your brother is Volvavin, huh？
This isn't funny. Every day, he bugs me to give him commands. "What now？" "What now？" and stuff like that.
Yeah, that seems tough...
By the way, do you and your brother still play as Volvavin？
Rinko
Hehehe, I'm getting better at it.
Really？ That's good.
Clean your room！ Go, Volve Fusion！ The next one is, brush your teeth！
Ah, now I see！
Right？ Our Volve Fusion Synchronization Level is beyond 120%.
I think you'd make a surprisingly good mother, ▲小早川＊▲.
"Surprisingly"？ Rinko's Volve Kick can deal some damage, you know？
Sorry, sorry！
Rinko
Hey, have you watched "The Beginning of Love and Passion"？
Ah, it's very popular among girls, huh？ I've never watched it though.
You should watch it.
Huh... so you also like those kinds of drama shows ▲小早川＊▲？
I'm surprised, too. At first, I just watched it with my new mom, but then I found it hard not to watch it afterward.
So that's why. Well then, maybe I'll try to watch it, too.
Hmm... Guys probably wouldn't understand, though.
What do you want me to do then...？
Rinko
Hey, ▲主人公＊▲.
Yeah？
If Rinko says "Please don't ask about my past," will you still trust Rinko？
Your past...？ While you were in junior high or in grade school？
No！ When women speak of the past, it means their past lovers.
Past lovers... Did something happen？
It's really suspicious. 'cause 3 of her past lovers are missing. I'll have to wait until next week to find out.
(So, it's about that drama show, huh...？)
Rinko
Ah, geez！
W-What is it？
She lost the memory of all 3 of her past lovers. I can't believe it！
Ah, you're talking about "The Beginning of Love and Sadness"？
Yeah. It's actually "Love and Passion." Geez, now that really bothers me.
How did it turn out that way？ Their scriptwriter has issues. Geez, I'm not gonna watch it anymore！
Now, now, it's just a drama.
Although it's just a drama, they can't make it like this. They have to explain everything before it ends, at least.
(So, you'll keep watching it until it ends, huh...？)
Rinko
Hah...
What is it...？ It's rare to see you sigh like that.
I watched the last episode of the drama...
Ah, you mean "The Beginning of Love"...
"And Passion." Hah...
Ah. When she lost the memory of all 3 of her past lovers, that was just unreasonable, right...
No. It's just unavoidable. A woman is just that kind of creature.
She just loves them so much. Guys will never understand this.
Geez... Can't you try to be gentler to Rinko？
(Yeah, right. Now, I don't understand you at all.)
Rinko
Hmm... I wonder...
What is it？
Has any girl ever said that you were cool, ▲主人公＊▲？
Eh？ Why do you ask？
No reason. So, your answer？
No, well... I don't think so... Again, why？
You know Hara-chan, right？ She said "Rinko's boyfriend is cool."
Hara-chan？ Is she a friend of yours？
Yeah, my classmate. She saw us talking to each other a while back.
I see... Yeah. She has a good eye, don't you think？
Well, she is Rinko's friend, after all. But... Well, cool...？
You don't have to be that confused about it...
Rinko
Oh yeah, someone confessed to Hara-chan.
Really？ Hara-chan... is your classmate, right？
Yeah. That's the thing. I've never really talked to her before but she started talking to me all of a sudden.
Oh... So, what happened？
She was troubled. She said it was weird and she didn't know much about the guy.
But she didn't feel bad about the confession, right？ That guy had the courage, at least.
Rinko didn't understand her. Hara-chan is the type that usually falls in love with guys first.
Earlier, she said that a guy like Rinko's boyfriend would be nice. But this guy is totally different.
Me？ How is he different？
He's very popular with the girls.
Ah, I see...
Rinko
Ah, right！ Hara-chan has finally started dating that guy.
That Mr. Popular Guy from earlier？
Yeah. They're together all the time, now. She promised to have lunch with Rinko once, but then she was like "Oh, sorry~"
Hah, friendship between girls is just like this. Aaah！
Hey, don't say that. I think Hara-chan would feel the same way when you're with me.
Yeah... Rinko also thought about that. That's just how it is, right？
No, that's wrong！ They are classmates and they can always be together. This is unfair！
Why don't you repeat the class, ▲主人公＊▲？
Don't say anything so unreasonable...
Rinko
Hara-chan broke up with her boyfriend.
That was quick！ ...So, why？
Well, after she thought about him carefully, she felt like he wasn't the right one.
When she heard Rinko boasting about Rinko's boyfriend, she felt kind of frustrated.
This time, Rinko really felt guilty, so Rinko apologized to her.
I see... Um, this must be a disaster for Mr. Popular Guy, huh？ But, hey...
Hmm？
You usually boast about me ▲小早川＊▲？
No, I wouldn't do anything like that.
But you said that Hara-chan...
I didn't say anything！ Geez, shut up already！
Rinko
Say...
Yeah？
Rinko is younger than you, right？ What do you think about that？
What do I think...？ Why？
No. I was just wondering... Nah, forget about it.
Rinko
Say...
Yes？
When guys are in high school, they usually fall for girls that are the same age or older, right？
Really？
That's what Rinko heard.
Well, it might be true.
...So, you actually prefer older women？ Do you wish that your girlfriend was older than you？
Actually, it's fine. Just forget I asked. Hehehe！
Rinko
Hey, sorry for asking such a weird question earlier. About older women and stuff...
I've been thinking about it. I also asked myself whether I'm the type that prefers older guys.
Then I realized it. If it's you, even if you're younger than me or the same age as me, I'd still fall in love with you.
I can't really imagine how things would be in that case, though. So I think it's fine like this.
Yeah... Whether you're older or younger than me, for me, it has to be you ▲小早川＊▲.
Thanks... Hehehe. I feel like crying now.
(▲小早川＊▲... I really have to treasure her.)
Rinko
Hey, I've been thinking about it again. About our age gap.
That again！？ Don't fuss over it.
Now, now, just listen to what I have to say.
Yeah, yeah. What is it？
When we think about our age, it's just about 1/16 or 1/17 of our life, right？
Well, I guess.
And when we're about 32 years old, it's going to be 1/32, half the current gap.
Ah, I see！ When we're 40, it's gonna be even smaller.
Right！ I might even overtake you by the time we become 50.
Oh no... I shouldn't let my guard down.
Hehehe！ But... I really wonder how it'd feel when we're at that age. It'd be nice if we can tackle it together.
Yeah... That'd be nice.
Rinko
Say... Are you picky with food？
Hmm... Well, I don't think that I'm picky. Why？
No particular reason. I just wanted to know.
And how about you, ▲小早川＊▲？
Haven't I told you before？ Potato chips！
So, what food do you dislike？
Nothing.
Really？ I thought you wouldn't like carrots or green peppers.
I'm not some kid！
It's not like I can't eat them, I just don't. Why bother about likes and dislikes？
(I think there are a lot of things that you dislike.)
Rinko
About food you like or hate...
Me？
Can you eat shiitake mushrooms？ How about raw oysters？ Hmm... Then how about green peas？
Why so many？ What's with them？
Because my parents are always like, "Eat your veggies！" Just to me！ It kinda gets on my nerves！
Don't get mad at me. I'm not the one saying anything like that.
Well, maybe you can use this opportunity to start eating vegetables.
I told you before, it's not like I can't eat them.
Don't you think that if you're picky, your younger brother will copy you？
That kinda pisses me off...
Good luck, big sister！
Have you tried eating some vegetables yet？
Rinko
I've been eating some lately. Why？
So you're trying your best, huh？ Good, good.
I have no choice. You said that my little brother would copy me...
They don't taste that bad when you're eating them, right？
Well... It depends on the type of food. I still can't eat raw vegetables！
Just thinking about lettuce or cabbage... Sometimes with disgusting bugs on the leaves...
Aaaaaaah！ Impossible！ Absolutely impossible！
Don't you know that if there are bugs on it, they're pesticide free？
Stop talking about it！ Those creepy bugs are haunting my imagination...
(You have a really strong imagination, huh？)
By the way, how's it going with the vegetables that you hate so much？
Rinko
Sorry, but I never said I hated them. I even eat them everyday.
Oh, so you really can do it.
Potatoes are vegetables too, right？
Potatoes...？ Don't tell me...
What？
Have you been eating potato chips？
They are crunchy fried potatoes, so they are acceptable, aren't they？
Hey！ What if your little brother starts eating potato chips everyday？
It's okay. I just don't eat them in front of my brother.
(I don't think that's the main problem though...)
Rinko
Say, what do you think when you look at me？ Do I look worn out？
Huh...？
Everyone in the Kobayakawa family is facing a crisis on the dining table.
What do you mean？
At first, it started with Mom going on diet.
Then it was followed by my dad who started to worry about his metabolism.
And？
Because carbohydrates make us fat, he substituted rice with tofu. You know, because it's made from soybeans.
Geez！ We're Japanese. We're supposed to eat rice！
(But it seems like her family is getting along well...)
Is your family continuing to eat healthy food？
Rinko
Sort of... But people can't stop eating rice, right？
We eat rice every day, so I think it's just a habit.
Now, it's the boiled tomato boom...
A tomato diet...？
When tomatoes are heated, they release licopene. It's got something to do with boosting metabolism.
If I'm forced to eat any more vegetables, I'll be starving in no time...
Somehow... I can only wish you luck.
The potato chips I secretly eat at night are my moral support.
(So you're still eating potato chips, huh...？)
Rinko
Finally, it's the end of my miserable era！
What are you talking about？
They've stopped serving the diet menus！
Oh, that's good.
Mom already lost 5 kilos. My dad didn't lose weight at all, though. I wonder why.
Just wish that her weight won't rebound later.
Don't jinx me like that. If this ever happens again, I'll absolutely run away from home.
At that time, I can stay with you, right？
Eh！？ Stay with me...？ That's probably not good...
Hah？ I was joking, of course...
(I already had my hopes up somehow...)
How's everything after your family's diet boom？
Rinko
It's been very peaceful.
Well, that's good.
The meals are delicious; the couple is happy; the brother is cute. Everything's all right.
What？ Why are you getting serious all of a sudden？
Right. The married couple is happy; their daughter is lovey-dovey with her boyfriend. So, no problem.
Eh？
Don't say that I'm lovey- dovey with you. Are you an idiot？
Rinko
So, what have you been doing lately？
Not much, really. How about you, ▲小早川＊▲？
I've gotten into the "Divy-chan collection." They're these palm-sized dolls, but they're kind of ugly and cute.
Ugly, and... cute？
But like, until you open the box, you can't tell which one's inside.
I see. They are like collectible items, huh？
I got all of the first series, and now they're on their second. I just need a few more and it'll be complete.
That would get pretty expensive, though, wouldn't it？
Right, that's the problem. There's a CD I want coming out this month, too. Geez, I wonder if I can get my allowance increased...
(Once she gets into something, she's really obsessed with it...)
Are you still into "Divy-chan"？
Rinko
Of course！ But the closer you get to a complete set, the more doubles you get, too.
Well, yeah.
That's why checking net auctions is my new daily chore.
But don't the rare ones cost a lot of money？
They sure do. The super- rare version that I want runs 3000 yen.
3000 yen...？ How much do they sell for？
300 yen each.
That's a pretty big gap...
Kinda feels like they're ripping you off！ Those jerks！
(Even so, you're still collecting them...)
Oh, right, how about those Divy-chan dolls we were talking about before？
Rinko
I finally did it！ Divy-chan Series Two！ Complete！
Nice. Good work. How did you get them？
In the end, I paid 3000 yen for it. Now I can't buy that CD I wanted.
It couldn't compete with Divy-chan, huh？
Divy-chan's round and ugly-cute eyes cried out to me, "Buy me！ Buy me！"
Well, you can always buy the CD next month, right？
Right, I don't regret it. However, I'm done with collectibles like this.
So, what did you do with your collection？
Of course, they are all safe in their boxes. It'd be terrible if my brother broke one.
(Is that really okay？)
Rinko
Hey. About Divy-chan...
Divy-chan, the ugly-cute doll？
The third series, "Glitzy- Glam Wicked☆ Edition" is coming out... What should I do？
Another series, huh？ Didn't you swear off Divy-chan, though？
Yeah, but they're so glitzy-glam and wicked！ I don't know. They're just too hideously cute！！？
You're gonna waste a lot more money on them...
But you can get a complete set on the net, with no doubles.
Without doubles, none of your money is wasted, right？
I-Is that so...？
That settles it！ I'm gonna get a complete set！
(And keep them in their boxes, I wonder...？)
You seem pretty busy lately.
Rinko
Kinda. It's temporary, but I actually just got a part- time job. Expenses have been piling up, and stuff.
Really！？ What kind of job is it？
A bookstore clerk.
That's fitting for a library committee member. Are you keeping up with it nicely？
Don't treat me like a kid. I can keep my priorities straight and get my work done.
Oh.
Though once in a while, when I'm sorting through books, I'll stop and read for just a little.
Just a little！
(Is that going to be okay...？)
By the way, how's the part-time job going？
Rinko
It's not so bad. There are still a lot that I have to learn, though.
What kind of work do you do？
Putting new books and magazines on shelves, manning the register, taking care of returns, stuff like that.
It's your first job, right？ What do you think about it？
Well, I think I'm doing pretty well. Better than you seem to think, anyway.
Huh. That's a relief.
What's that about？ I don't need any worrying. I can get things done when I want to.
Hahaha, you can say that again.
How's your job at the bookstore？
Rinko
Ah, I quit.
What happened？ Did you get fired？
Didn't I say it was temporary？
Oh, I see.
It was more fun than I thought, though, so maybe I'll go back to it.
Are you looking forward to your first paycheck？
Not really. But no one hates money, right？
(I bet you're really looking forward to it.)
Speaking of which, you must've just gotten paid, right？
Rinko
What are you scheming at？
Geez！ You make it sound like I'm such a bad guy...
Just kidding. It's not much, but I've got a little economic surplus, I guess.
So I'll get a book, then that CD. If there's some left over, maybe some clothes, too.
Hahaha... It's okay to be happy, but you have to use it carefully, okay？
What are you, my dad？ Don't worry. It's because I wanted these things that I got a part time job in the first place.
Yeah？ What is it you wanted？
You know, girls need money for this and that！ You can't always wear the same stuff for dates, right？
(I see. So she was worrying about our dates...)
I may have asked this before, but what kind of music do you like, ▲小早川＊▲？
Rinko
Hmm...？
What's wrong？
When you keep asking the same question over and over, it's like you're so childish.
Really？ I just wanted to know what you like, ▲小早川＊▲.
...Hmm. Fine then. To put it simply, punk.
Is that different to rock？
You can say it's different, but punk is a kind of rock.
Hmm？
Better stop this. It's embarrassing.
(Why？)
How come you started listening to Western music ▲小早川＊▲？
Rinko
That's probably an influence from Dad.
Your father likes it so he taught you to listen, or something like that？
You exaggerated a bit. It's just that he always had punk music on in the house. As a child, I just simply listened.
Ah, do you still talk with your dad about music？
Not really. Dad doesn't seem to listen to punk music much anymore.
I see. But that still made you like that genre, huh, ▲小早川＊▲？
Maybe. Punk is rebellious music, after all.
I see.
But recently I've turned away from it. And it's someone's fault...
(Who？ I wonder...)
You don't listen to music lately, huh, ▲小早川＊▲？
Rinko
I don't listen to music all the time, but I still listen.
Then do you check the hit charts and stuff？
I'd pass on such things.
Is that so.
Too many people already listen to them, right？ And most of them are love songs. Nothing's good.
Hmm, very difficult to understand.
Hit songs these days are just too superficial.
But you can talk about them with others.
I don't care about that. I don't want to get all hyped up with such things.
I wonder if I should learn more about Western music.
Rinko
Huh？ Why？
Why？ So that I can be a boyfriend who understands your taste in music. Isn't that something good, ▲小早川＊▲？
No-no. No need. You won't understand.
I see. So I can't, huh？
No, I didn't mean that. It's just...
People should enjoy what they like. If they are forced to like something, that is not enjoyable.
I'm not forced or anything but if you say so ▲小早川＊▲...
You're not that superficial type. It's better that we are tied by something more meaningful than that.
If we are like that, Rinko will be very happy.
Rinko
Ah, this time, my family is going to do bathroom remodeling.
Like, redecoration？
Yeah. During that time, we'll have to use a public bathhouse. It's very exciting.
You usually don't go there, huh？ When I was there last time, I was too excited that I made some old guys angry.
Hey, after you got out of the public bath, did you drink fruit-flavored milk？
I can't remember... But I think I used to.
If you hold the bottle at exactly 45 degree, you can drink it in one gulp, you know？
R-Really...？
That's the proper way to drink it. My dad taught me.
(Is it really true...？)
By the way, have you been to the public bathhouse yet？
Rinko
Yes. The bathtub was so big. It felt really good.
You know, nowadays, some bathhouses are more than just a big bathtub.
What do you mean？
They have jacuzzi and massage water streams too.
They even have a bathtub with a light electric shock.
So a bathhouse also has to renovate.
I felt like I was in a theme park.
(Using a public bathhouse occasionally might be nice, huh？)
By the way, do you still have to use the public bathhouse？
Rinko
Yeah. And you know what？ The fees are different for adults, kids, and the ones in-between.
I understand adults and kids, but what are the ones in-between？
Like someone around the age of 6 to 12, I think.
About the ages of grade school students, huh？ Middle school students have to pay adult fees then.
Right... But that old man, the owner of the bathhouse. For Rinko, he...
Huh？
I'm so pissed. Never mind. I don't wanna talk about this！
(What is it then...？)
Earlier you mentioned that you're having your bathroom renovated. Is it done？
Rinko
Yes, it's done. What should I say...？ It's sparkling now like a brand new bathroom.
So you don't go to the public bathhouse anymore？
I don't. I kind of regret it though.
But now my bathroom is just so awesome.
It has a jacuzzi and even a misty sauna too.
Oh, sounds luxurious, huh？ It must feel really good in there.
Right. You wanna give it a try？
What！？
There！ Don't ever picture anything perverted in your head！
Lately, have you done anything fun？
Rinko
Lately, I enjoy going to the arcade, I think.
You were playing fighting games before, weren't you, ▲小早川＊▲？
Yeah. A new one came out, and I'm getting pretty good at it.
Yeah？
Well, Rinko is known as a veteran gamer around this arcade.
As the brutal girl who starts kicking people when she gets angry...？
I'm talking about games！
Ouch！
Just what part of me is brutal？
(That part！ There！)
Do you regularly go to the arcade？
Rinko
Hiya！ Light kick！ Smack！
That hurts！ What's with the kicking all of a sudden？
I didn't have anywhere to vent my anger！
In that case, don't make me your outlet.
But you know... It was really frustrating！
What was frustrating？
There's this guy I can't beat no matter what in a game.
I always had nice matches with him though...
Aaah！ Thinking about it makes me angry again！ Yaah！
(In that case, don't kick me...)
You look pretty down. Did something happen？
Rinko
That guy who uses Makoto hasn't been coming to the arcade lately...
Makoto？ Oh, a game character？ The guy you told me you couldn't beat no matter what, ▲小早川＊▲...
That's right！ I even developed a special anti-Makoto strategy, and toured all of the other arcades with it！
You went that far？ I guess you're pretty... tenacious.
If he hadn't shown up, I would've quit while I was ahead.
Even though I've turned my Reiko into a real Makoto-killer.
I know how you feel, but you're getting too wrapped up in this.
Hiya！
(Ouch！)
You seem to be in a good mood. Something happened？
Rinko
Hmm, I guess. I finally beat that Makoto-user.
Nice job. Payback, huh？
Of course！ ...Well, even though I only won two out of thirteen.
Plus, I tried talking to him a little bit. He said he'd come by more often.
...Huh？
What？ Are you getting jealous？
Of course not...
Don't worry about it. You're a Rinko-killer. Even that Makoto-user couldn't lay a finger on you.
Rinko
My folks are the worst.
What's up？
They're like, "Your room has a bad atmosphere," and then they put this potted cactus in there.
A cactus...？ Why is that？
Said it was feng shui.
Feng shui？ Like, life force and stuff... That feng shui？
Yeah. They said a cactus would protect me against bad energy and stuff.
It's gonna wreck my room's ambience！
(Huh？ I haven't heard of that before.)
Are your parents still into feng shui？
Rinko
Unfortunately, yes. Now I have to take care of that cactus.
It's not like I asked for it. I don't know how to keep a cactus.
Well, who would, right？
I had to look it up on the internet. I've been watering it and stuff, but...
Actually, I heard that if you talk to a cactus, it'll grow better.
Yeah, I know. But I can't possibly do that. I'd die of shame.
Do you think a sane high school girl should stay in her room alone and talk to a potted cactus？
(Yeah, that's true...)
So, how's that cactus you got？
Rinko
Hm？ You mean Tama？
"Tama"？ You house has a pet cat now, ▲小早川＊▲？
Nope. Tama the cactus. It's kinda round, like a ball. I named it Tama.
I get it. So, how's Tama doing, then？
Well... I don't want to talk to it, so I put music on for it, instead.
Yeah？ How's it going？
Since I put the speakers next to it, it's grown a lot！ I'm not making it up. It's really noticeable！
Tama the cactus loves punk rock... It might start dancing to the music one day.
(I think I've seen toys like that...)
How's your cactus...？ I mean how's Tama doing？
Rinko
Good. She's blooming！ Cute little pink ones.
She's so pretty now, so Tama is definitely a girl.
I don't think cacti come in boys or girls...
Oh, shut up. It's cute so that's all right.
It surprised me that you like cute things. Like cats and stuff like that, ▲小早川＊▲.
Cats are different！
I don't start screaming, "Aaaaw！ It's so cute！" at the drop of a hat, like other high school girls.
Yeah, that's true.
Your girlfriend is a connoisseur, okay？
